column3: School of Area Studies, Sociology, History, Politics and Literature
column5: OverviewKeep working toward a better world, and creating a vision of what a fairer, interconnected global community could be, with this interdisciplinary Master's in International Development.You'll shape your existing passion and knowledge of the sector into the practical tools, strategies and techniques needed by organisations working in international development. You'll explore issues such as colonialism and globalisation, and tailor the course to your interests by choosing modules that focus on the sustainable development goal closest to your heart.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 year full time distance learning, 2 years part time distance learning
